semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Non-Pressure Ulcers That Progress During Admission
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 12. Chapter 12: Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue > b. Non-Pressure Chronic Ulcers > 3. Patient admitted with non-pressure ulcer that progresses to another severity level during the admission

content.full_text: If a patient is admitted to an inpatient hospital with a non-pressure ulcer at one severity level and it progresses to a higher severity level, two separate codes should be assigned: one code for the site and severity level of the ulcer on admission and a second code for the same ulcer site and the highest severity level reported during the stay. See Section I.B.14. for pressure ulcer stage documentation by clinicians other than patient's provider (Evidence: pg no: 60, L19-L21)
content.summary: When non-pressure ulcers progress to higher severity during admission, assign two codes: one for admission severity and one for highest severity during stay (Evidence: pg no: 60, L19-L21)
key_concepts: Two separate codes (Evidence: pg no: 60, L20)
Highest severity during stay (Evidence: pg no: 60, L21)
Same ulcer site (Evidence: pg no: 60, L21)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If a patient is admitted to an inpatient hospital with a non-pressure ulcer at one severity level and it progresses to a higher severity level, two separate codes should be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 60, L19-L20)
detailed_rules.explanation: Ulcer progression during admission requires dual coding to capture both initial and final severity states (Evidence: pg no: 60, L19-L20)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign one code for the site and severity level of the ulcer on admission and a second code for the same ulcer site and the highest severity level reported during the stay (Evidence: pg no: 60, L20-L21)
detailed_rules.explanation: The two codes represent the admission state and the highest severity reached during the entire stay (Evidence: pg no: 60, L20-L21)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify non-pressure ulcer present on admission with documented severity
Step 2: Determine if ulcer progressed to higher severity during stay
Step 3: Assign first code for admission site and severity
Step 4: Assign second code for same site with highest severity during stay
Step 5: Reference Section I.B.14 for documentation by other clinicians
